------

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/willmcgugan/rich/pull/187?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/willmcgugan/rich/pull/187?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [579a29c...62c4448](https://codecov.io/gh/willmcgugan/rich/pull/187?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Reliable builds wouldn’t work if you install things under a different name. Besides, the core lib is all relative. The absolute imports are all in the main sections.

If you need this, add a test that increases coverage and I’ll consider merging.
There is an instance of non-relative imports outside of __main__ sections, in logging.py.  Just those could be fixed if you prefer.
